response.answer_text: When you get together or you visit them, try leaving your purse or wallet home and observe how they treat you and welcome you and how much effort they make to be with you. Real eye opener.

I figure there is a little bit of give and take in any relationship… but if you're doing all the giving, and they're doing all the taking, it's time to evaluate whether you're going to continue with this situation or run like the wind! Easier said than done, but you'll eventually get tired, or they'll move on.

Hi there, You know as they say what you want to hear so that you give them what they want…it’s call selfishness or an extreme case narcissism these people are often just very immature and need to be left to there own devices and not to be partnered with.

I would assume the first sign would be that you feel the imbalance of the relationship. If you are giving more than getting, you may be getting used. If you are threatened that they will leave if you don’t provide something would also be a red light. I believe if you are asking you already know you are.

When you develop a good instinct, you will know a person before you even get to know them. The way the person talks to you the timing that they ask you for something and the way they respond to you when you need help, is what tells you if they are users or real friends.

When they don’t answer you promptly, even though there are there and you are trying to talk to them they would pretend as if they are too busy to notice you. When they keep loading you with lots of work and won’t do a single favor you ask them for.

This is just a matter of commonsense. Just observe his bahaviours. If he is trying of take advantage once or twice, it may be due to love and affection. But if he is taking advantage again and again, you need to be alert. Definitely he is taking advantage of you. A keen observation and basic knowledge of human psychology will help to uncover many mystery of human behaviour.

If you mean, how do you know if he only want to take advantage of you, I think you already suspect a boy only wants to do that. If he treats you with respect, wants to do things with you, is not afraid to meet your parents or talk to you in public. You know. Trust yourself.

How can you tell if you’re being taken advantage of or if someone is just really needy? The difference between being a friend legitimately needing a lot of help and being taken advantage of is that a friend is still a friend when they don’t need help. In fact, they even offer to help you every once in a while.

Thanks for the answer request! From your description it seems like your boyfriend’s being a total dick (no offense.) I wouldn’t say he's “playing you,” but i do think that maybe things have begun to change in your relationship and you guys may find yourself at a distance. You should consider confronting him when there’s a right time and see what’s going on. It’s almost been a year of dating, and if he’s always busy and never has time for you anymore it’s best to bring it up and hopefully discuss where your relationship is at. A lot of the time no one is the same as they once were in the beginning of a relationship, whether it’s good or not and since you feel like he’s changed that’s something else you might want to bring up too. You aren't being played, you’re just having a bump in the road and it’s best to follow your gut instead of being pulled along constantly questioning whether or not your relationship is still as strong, you deserve more than that. Goodluck! I hope everything works out for the best.

Confusion. Inconsistencies with behaviour and words, ex saying and doing things then saying they never did(gaslighting) . Little lies. Unable to look you in the eye for long periods, conscious kicks in or they look away becuz of awareness of deceit towards you. There are many others these are the ones easily looked over.

When your life is consumed with working for someone else you’re probably being taken advantage of. Build a life outside of working for other people. Explore life fulfillment away from work. They are only paying you for your time. Invest in YOU.

response.answer_text: It is different for everybody. Everyone has what they can, and cannot tolerate. Do you feel taken advantage of? Do you feel uncomfortable, when certain people ask you for favors? If so, then maybe they are taking advantage of you.

Not really cause people are such good liars nowadays. Just be alert and don’t be afraid to question people when they make you seem uneasy. Trust lightly and always be on guard. My mom always tell me to be aware of my surroundings. You do the same.

This depends on what situation and with whom. Generally though you will be asked to do things more than once that you dont feel are fair. It could be volunteering, taxi rides for someone quite capable of organising themselves. It may mean giving more than you can afford like money or resources or the most important one…your time. Also there wont be a reciprocal arrangement where they do the same for you or if they do it will be hardly at all, just a token effort.

in every deal, there is one fool if you can’t find it in the other person then consider it yourself…. start counting how many times you’ve been fooled if the ratio is high towards you then its time for you to take the action.
A person who takes advantage of others is an opportunist or a manipulator. Their main objective is to gain something from others in order to achieve success, social status, and/or material wealth.

The most important thing is, he has no respect for you. He does not care for you feelings, emotions, thoughts, likes and dislikes. He is not willing to pay hotel bills etc. and becomes happy when you pay. He lies frequently.

Let's take sex out of the equation, since I don't know if you mean taking advantage sexually or otherwise. With sex out of the picture, you can tell if a man is taking advantage of you by asking yourself, would I accept this from a woman?, If no, you are being taken advantage of. If yes, you are good.

Are you really going ask this question. I get the feeling you want something in return from the person hence you are allowing to be taken advantage. Just cut ties. Simple as. No need to go round in circles with the person. If you need that person in your life the accept the chances of repeated behaviour.

always when you are with them ask your self “why im i here what are we doing” if u answer yourself with something like “to do that for them…to give them money” if thats u answer many times it means they r taking advantage of you
When that person instead of thinking "Would you do something for him/her?" Thinks " You WOULD do that thing for him/her"

Yes. But it took me a long time and a lot of counseling to learn to spot it. It doesn't have to, though. Google “how to spot manipulation" and also read about narcissists behaviors. You can teach yourself to recognize it if you read up. It's a critical skill to have in life.

A boy might not respond to your text messages unless you ask him to go somewhere with you. And he won’t offer to hang out with you. Or he only wants to be around you in public to show other that he is in a relationship. Any other questions?

You can ask that person to do something for you but more than once there are chances that they might help you for once or twice but if they are using you then they won't help you frequently or do you a favor
This means that those particular people are abusing you falsely or in other words they are tricking and misusing you in order for to do what they want you to.
All employees should be used at work. That is what employees are for. But if you mean “used” as in dishonestly taken, then your question needs a lot more detail.

You will just feel it..though there will be certain things that will make u feel so : he talks the same way with everyonehe loves ur body more than ur soulhe is not caringhe will let u downhe will make u feel bad and insecure about ho u look or the way u ru will loose urself when with him
im a target of people that like to take advantage. they just feel fake and you can tell their phony. passive aggressive
When you are constantly being asked to do favors, without getting any appreciation or acknowledgement.

It is difficult to tell. Look to what the man is providing for the lady. The relationship should be mutual in terms of providing support, love, commitment, affection, status, honesty, friendship, benefits, material gifts and loyalty.
When you can't say No to them. They need you in when you are in your important time. They don't treat your important time with value.
We all take advantage of each other. Some people are just better at it than others.
I need to find out if I can press charges on my sister who is taking advantage of my disability while I live with her

If you are consistently being asked to do tasks that have nothing to do with your job description, then yes. Especially, if they are only asking you to do things because they don’t want to do them even though it is technically their job to do so. Passing the buck isn’t unusual, but that doesn’t make it right. Don’t let employers abuse you. Stand up for yourself and if they continue, find another job that will appreciate your efforts.
Is he using you for sex?No regard for how you feel?Does is he force you into things you don’t want to be forced into?If yes to any of these then yeah he is.
You may not know so you have to be careful. Reassess the situation every so often and see whether you’re getting anything out of it.
They are only around when they benefit no other time. Disregard for your needs.
Yes.
